text: Hi everyone. In this lesson, we're going to go and take a look again at the subsurface materials and all the details that we can create from a simplistic ice type of effect to one that's a little bit more complex. So let's get started. We saw in the last lesson how we can create a fernel index node inside of our opacity as well as our subsurface inputs and we actually could get some pretty good effects. Now, this doesn't actually have to be really complex. It can be pretty simple which I'm going to show you in just a second. But you can also add a bit of complexity with a world alignment texture node which allows us to be able to blend things such as the subsurface textures as well as even the normals which actually work really well, which I do show you in another class. But in this particular case, let's go and take a look at each one of these and how we can create some really great things. Now, you also could use a more complex fernel index if you wanted to and it gives you a breakdown here of exactly what each one of those inputs to. Do you need it? Not necessarily. Sometimes less is more. But you do have the option of getting a cheap contrast, dark and light if you want or dark and bright. But that's really up to you as well as you can invert the effect if you needed to as adjusting things also with a camera vector or a normal vector, which is nice. Now there is no alignment node, world aligned texture node inside of the normal. We have an add, multiply and then an add, putting them in our scene and controlling the texture size. And we're putting that right in combo with a multiply, a subsurface color, a subsurface scale. And we're bringing that right into the subsurface color here. And that allows us to control the look and feel a bit more for that subsurface variety if we needed it. And if we instance these, we can make each one look a little bit different than the other. Now you do need to expose parameters when you do this. So what that means is you want to convert to a parameter here, as well as any other items such as your scalars, like you might want to convert this one too and say, hey, this is going to control overall alignment amount. And this one here, subsurface scale, which is already promoted. And then this one here could be just color amount here and you can convert that to a parameter. And when you create an instance, you'll be able to have access to those and edit those accordingly. Pretty great to be able to have this ability to be able to do this and to be able to control your subsurface and have all these things at your fingertips. So keep those things in mind. Thanks again.
